form.name: form1

div.span: School Closed for Remainder of 2019-2020 Academic Year Due to Governor DeWine's Executive Order

span.div: In an effort to reduce the spread of COVID-19, Ohio governor Mike DeWine issued an executive order closing all Ohio K-12 schools for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year. Administration and staff at Eastern Local Schools will continue to work diligently to provide needed resources for our students and families, including meals and instructional resources, until further notice.

In addition to the district all-call system, the school website will serve as the central location for all of the available services and resources being made available to our students. To view these resources, please click HERE.

br.span: There will be a drive through cook out at Eastern Local School on April 26th from 3-5 by door 22. Please drive by and grab some food. Everyone is welcome and we ask that you please share this with everyone. There will be no deliveries and everyone must stay in their cars.

span.div: Greetings kindergarten families! Due to the current school closure mandated by Governor DeWine, kindergarten registration for the 2020-2021 school year will be completed online. Families will be contacted as soon as the restrictions are lifted for a face to face registration meeting.
Please complete the form and watch all videos in the links below:
If you are unable to complete the form or view the videos, please call Mr. Hines at (740) 226-6402.

In an effort to reduce the spread of COVID-19, Ohio governor Mike DeWine issued an executive order closing all Ohio K-12 schools for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year. Administration and staff at Eastern Local Schools will continue to work diligently to provide needed resources for our students and families, including meals and instructional resources, until further notice.

In addition to the district all-call system, this page will serve as the central location for all of the available services and resources being made available to our students. To view these resources, please click Read More below.

As a part of our continued effort to strengthen our school culture, Eastern Middle/High School has begun a monthly Monday Motivation assembly in which students will hear a message of encouragement at the very beginning of their week. At our first assembly, district superintendent, Neil Leist, spoke to students on overcoming difficult situations with perseverance, maintaining a positive and respectful attitude, and by setting goals. Additionally, the event was kicked off with the video below, created by Eastern students and staff in collaboration with the OSU Endeavor Center.

The Eastern High School science club is currently holding their annual seed sale. Purchase a bag full of a variety of seeds for $10. Seeds can be purchased in the Eastern High School office or by contacting Mr. Legg or any member of the science club.

img.title: SOMC
img.alt: SOMC Eastern Family Practice Open to the Public

div.a: SOMC Eastern Family Practice Open to the Public

span.div: The SOMC Eastern Family Practice has officially opened and is now taking public appointments. The office began seeing patients on Monday, January 6, 2020 and held it's open house and ribbon cutting ceremonies on January 8, 2020. The office is open to both students at Eastern Local Schools and community members. The office is open from Monday to Friday from 8:00am to 4:30pm. Appointments can be made by calling (740) 226-1552. To enter the clinic, the public must enter door 14 located on the northeast corner of the building near the Beaver Pike entrance.

span.p: Atomic Credit Union believes a solid and well-rounded education must also include real-world lessons. That's why we have partnered with 17 school districts located throughout Ohio to establish more than 35 Student-Run Credit Union Branches. Students are provided hands-on learning activities and job duties concerning Personal Finances and the Financial Industry.

p.span: At Eastern Local Schools, we give our students the opportunity to experience hands-on financial education by participating in the Student-Run Credit Union. The students can open a FREE savings account and learn the importance of saving their money through this program. They can deposit money during open hours at the Eagles Student-Run Credit Union or at any of the Atomic Credit Union branches.

span.div: For more information about the program and signup instructions, click the Read More link below.
